name: ManageMailchimpListMembers
description:
Batch subscribe or unsubscribe members in a Mailchimp list.

Use this tool to add or remove multiple members from a specific Mailchimp list. Ideal for managing subscriber lists efficiently.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the specific Mailchimp list to manage.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

parameters.name: batch_manage_members_data
parameters.description: JSON array of subscriber objects to add or update, each including email, status, merge fields, etc. Up to 500 members per request.

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.

members.description: An array of objects, each representing an email address and the subscription status for a specific list. Up to 500 members may be added or updated with each API call.

sync_tags.description: Whether this batch operation will replace all existing tags with tags in request.

update_existing.description: Whether this batch operation will change existing members' subscription status.

parameters.name: allow_incomplete_merge_fields
parameters.description: Allows member data without required merge fields if set to true. Defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: ignore_duplicate_members
parameters.description: Set to true to ignore duplicate entries in the batch request, saving the first occurrence.

value_schema.description: If skip_duplicate_check is true, we will ignore duplicates sent in the request when using the batch sub/unsub on the lists endpoint. The status of the first appearance in the request will be saved. This defaults to false.

metadata.description: Tools that enable LLMs to interact directly with the Mailchimp Marketing API.

parameters.name: skip_merge_validation
parameters.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If skip_merge_validation is true, member data will be accepted without merge field values, even if the merge field is usually required. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: skip_duplicate_check
parameters.description: If skip_duplicate_check is true, we will ignore duplicates sent in the request when using the batch sub/unsub on the lists endpoint. The status of the first appearance in the request will be saved. This defaults to false.

value_schema.description: If skip_duplicate_check is true, we will ignore duplicates sent in the request when using the batch sub/unsub on the lists endpoint. The status of the first appearance in the request will be saved. This defaults to false.

parameters.name: list_id
parameters.description: The unique ID for the list.

value_schema.description: The unique ID for the list.

email_type.description: Type of email this member asked to get ('html' or 'text').

merge_fields.description: A dictionary of merge fields where the keys are the merge tags. See the [Merge Fields documentation](https://mailchimp.com/developer/marketing/docs/merge-fields/#structure) for more about the structure.

interests.description: The key of this object's properties is the ID of the interest in question.

ip_signup.description: IP address the subscriber signed up from.

timestamp_signup.description: The date and time the subscriber signed up for the list in ISO 8601 format.

ip_opt.description: The IP address the subscriber used to confirm their opt-in status.

timestamp_opt.description: The date and time the subscriber confirmed their opt-in status in ISO 8601 format.

members.description: An array of objects, each representing an email address and the subscription status for a specific list. Up to 500 members may be added or updated with each API call.

sync_tags.description: Whether this batch operation will replace all existing tags with tags in request.

update_existing.description: Whether this batch operation will change existing members' subscription status.

secrets.description: The OAuth token to use for authentication.
